Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PG-1 analog 1 (TTpTT, Synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, XXA, UCLL1c; XXD1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, pig cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (72.22%) toPG-1R: 28%, T: 22%, G: 17%.Chemical modification:  central proline is a D-amino acid.Activity: active against E. coli JM109 (MIC 6.3 ug/ml), B. subtilis BR151 (MIC 25 ug/ml), penicillin-resistant S. aureus 1206 (MIC 50 ug/ml), and vancomycin-resistant E. faecium A634 (MIC 12.5-25 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM), NaCl-insensitive:B. subtilis (150 mM), NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus (150 mM), NaCl-sensitive:E. faecium (150 mM).Structure:  NMR studies confirmed the beta structure of analog 1. 150 mM NaCl had not effect on structure.
Literature Information.Author: Lai JR, Huck BR, Weisblum B, Gellman SH. 2002
Literature Information.Title: Design of non-cysteine-containing antimicrobial beta-hairpins: structure-activity relationship studies with linear protegrin-1 analogues.
